1.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
a ram (as full-grown and fat), including a battering-ram (as butting); hence, a meadow (as for sheep); also a pad or camel's saddle (as puffed out)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)
near, with or among; often in general, to
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

2.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a bird (as covered with feathers, or rather as covering with wings), often collectively
properly, to wave to and fro (rarely to flap up and down); figuratively, to rove, flee, or (causatively) to drive away
a nest (as fixed), sometimes including the nestlings; figuratively, a chamber or dwelling
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Moab, an incestuous son of Lot; also his territory and descendants
a crossing-place (of a river, a ford; of a mountain, a pass); abstractly, a transit, i.e. (figuratively) overwhelming
the Arnon, a river east of the Jordan, also its territory

3.brief: to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to place (in a very wide application)
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre
a light (i.e. window); dual double light, i.e. noon
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
to push off; used in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (to expel, mislead, strike, inflict, etc.)
properly, to wave to and fro (rarely to flap up and down); figuratively, to rove, flee, or (causatively) to drive away
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal

4.brief: properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid)
to push off; used in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (to expel, mislead, strike, inflict, etc.)
Moab, an incestuous son of Lot; also his territory and descendants
to be (in the sense of existence)
a cover (in a good or a bad, a literal or a figurative sense)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to be burly, i.e. (figuratively) powerful (passively, impregnable); by implication, to ravage
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
to complete, in a good or a bad sense, literal, or figurative, transitive or intransitive
to tread upon (as a potter, in walking or abusively)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

5.brief: properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
David, the youngest son of Jesse
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity

6.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
Moab, an incestuous son of Lot; also his territory and descendants
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)
arrogance or majesty; by implication, (concretely) ornament
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
a brag or lie; also a liar

7.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to howl (with a wailing tone) or yell (with a boisterous one)

Kir-Cheres or Kir-Chareseth, a place in Moab

a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only

8.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
Cheshbon, a place East of the Jordan
to droop; by implication to be sick, to mourn
a vine (as twining), especially the grape
Sebam or Sibmah, a place in Moab
a master; hence, a husband, or (figuratively) owner (often used with another noun in modifications of this latter sense)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to strike down; by implication, to hammer, stamp, conquer, disband
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
Jaazer or Jazer, a place East of the Jordan

properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)
to vacillate, i.e. reel or stray (literally or figuratively); also causative of both
a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)
properly, to pound, i.e. smite; by implication (as if beating out, and thus expanding) to disperse; also, to thrust off, down, out or upon (inclusively, reject, let alone, permit, remit, etc.)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
